intro: Hieracium multistriatum, commonly known as the multistriate hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its yellow flowers appear in late summer, and it produces seeds in achenes that are dispersed by wind. Hieracium multistriatum is often found in meadows, pastures, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
